title: Excel LEFT Function

metadata.description: Learn about Excel LEFT Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel LEFT Function

LEFT Function
The
LEFT
function is used to retrieve a chosen amount of characters
content_sections.content:
, counting from the left side of an Excel cell.
 The chosen number has to be greater than 0 and is set to 1 by default.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=LEFT
If you want to use the function on a single cell, write:
=LEFT(
cell
)
If you want to use the function on a range of cells, write:
=LEFT(
start cell
:
end cell
)
How to Use LEFT Function
To retrieve values from the left side of an Excel cell, use
LEFT
.
Step 1)
Start the LEFT function
Select a cell
E2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=LEFT
Double click the
LEFT
command
Name	Type 1	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting	305
    Poliwrath	Water	510
    Victreebel	Grass	490
    Tentacool	Water	335
    Magneton	Electric	465
    Dewgong	Water	475
    Cloyster	Water	525
    Onix	Rock	385
    Dragonair	Dragon	420
    Pidgeotto	Normal	349
    Rattata	Normal	253
    Beedrill	Bug	395
    Doduo	Normal	310
    Kingler	Water	475
    Nidoqueen	Poison	505
    Hitmonchan	Fighting	455
    Charmeleon	Fire	405
    Arbok	Poison	438
    Gastly	Ghost	310
    Magikarp	Water	200
Copy Values
Follow along the tutorial by trying it yourself!
Copy the values in the example above and try it on your own!
Step 2)
Enter values to the LEFT function
Select a cell (
A2
)

content_sections.title: Hit enter
content_sections.content:
=LEFT(A2)
uses the default funcion of
LEFT
and retrieves the first symbol from the
A2
cell.

content_sections.title: Learn to use
content_sections.content:
=LEFT
to get more than one character.
Step 1)
Start the LEFT function
Select a cell
E2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=LEFT
Double click the
LEFT
command
Note:
The different parts of the function are separated by a symbol, like comma
,
or semicolon
;
The symbol depends on your
Language Settings
.
Step 2)
Select cells and set the number of characters
Enter the cell name (
A2
) and define the length of characters you want to retrieve, using a
,
as a delimiter (
A2,3
)
Hit enter
The function returns the first 3 characters from cell
A2
.
How to use the
LEFT
Function on a Range of Cells
Step 1)
Start the LEFT function
Select a cell
E2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=LEFT
Double click the
LEFT
command
Step 2)
Select cells and number of characters
Select the cells (
A2:A4
) and define the length of characters you want to retrieve, using a
,
as a delimiter (
A2:A4,3
)
Hit enter
The function returns the first 3 characters from each cell within the range
A2:A4
.

★
+1

quiz.question:
What is Excel LEFT Function

LEFT Function
The
LEFT
function?
options: used to retrieve a chosen amount of characters
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Excel LEFT Function

LEFT Function
The
LEFT
function is 'used to retrieve a chosen amount of characters'.

quiz.question: What is and?
options: used to retrieve a chosen amount of characters
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of and is 'set to 1 by default'.

summary: This tutorial covers Excel LEFT Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Excel LEFT Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Excel LEFT Function and how to apply it in your projects.
